thread.title: Armed duo rob Christchurch dairy of cigarettes
thread.title_full: Armed duo rob Christchurch dairy of cigarettes

title: Armed duo rob Christchurch dairy of cigarettes
text:
Armed duo rob Christchurch dairy of cigarettes Last updated 13:30, February 5 2017 FAIRFAX NZ 
The Kidbrooke Convenience store in Christchurch was robbed by two men armed with weapons. 
Two armed men have robbed a dairy of cigarettes in Christchurch. 
A police spokeswoman said the men entered the Kidbrooke Convenience store on Kidbrooke St in Bromley about 8pm on Saturday. 
The men, armed with weapons, took off with "a number of items" including cigarettes, police said. 
The spokeswoman was unable to say what the weapons were or what was taken for "operational reasons". Police were examining CCTV footage. Anyone who witnessed the incident, or who saw any suspicious activity in the area, around the time was asked to contact Christchurch Police on (03) 363 7400. Alternatively, information can be provided anonymously to Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111.
